Mayor and City Council
======================

| ![Greg Redden - District 1](https://www.taylortx.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=15504)**District 1** [**Greg Redden**](https://www.taylortx.gov/948/15119/Greg-Redden) *([email](mailto:greg.redden@taylortx.gov))* | Shelli Cobb - District 2**District 2** [**Shelli Cobb**](https://www.taylortx.gov/1191/20087/Shelli-Cobb)  ([email](mailto: shelli.cobb@taylortx.gov)) | Kelly Cmerek - District 3 **District 3** [**Kelly Cmerek**](https://www.taylortx.gov/1192/20088/Kelly-Cmerek) ***Mayor Pro Tem***  ([email](mailto: kelly.cmerek@taylortx.gov)) | Heather Long - District 4**District 4** [**Heather Long**](https://www.taylortx.gov/1286/Heather-Long)  ([email](mailto:heather.long@taylortx.gov)) | Dwayne Ariola - At Large**At Large** [**Dwayne Ariola**](https://www.taylortx.gov/557/Dwayne-Ariola)  ***Mayor*** ([email](mailto: dwayne.ariola@taylortx.gov)) |

City Government
---------------

The City of Taylor has an elected City Council that is comprised of five Council Members, four of whom are elected from single member districts and one Member elected At-Large (see who represents you on the city [District Map](https://mallard.maps.arcgis.com/apps/instant/lookup/index.html?appid=ce83e323b5be4cc384a093d5ce861a83)). Council members elect from their number a Mayor and a Mayor Pro Tem.

Taylor is a Home Rule City, which means that the Council can enact legislation, adopt budgets, and determine policies, subject only to limitations imposed by the State Constitution and the [City Charter](https://www.taylortx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/11763/City-Charter-2020-FINAL). The City Council is also guided by the [Rules of Decorum](https://www.taylortx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/15794) and [Elected Officials Social Media Policy](https://www.taylortx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/15795) to ensure their commitment to preserving the integrity of local government.

Presently, the Mayor and Mayor Pro Tem are appointed by the council following each election for a one-year term. In May 2024, voters elected to amend the City Charter to change the at-large council position to Mayor. This change will take effect in May 2026 when the at-large position is up for reelection. Visit the [Election page](https://www.taylortx.gov/251/City-Elections "Election page") for more information regarding the election process.

[Historical list of City Commissioners/Council Members](https://www.taylortx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/10025/Previous-Commissioners-by-date-WEBSITE)

Meetings
--------

Council meetings are held at 6 p.m. the second and fourth Thursdays of each month at City Hall, 400 Porter Street.

[Click here to visit our video page to watch live or view at a later date](https://www.taylortx.gov/965/Videos).

* Special meetings are called as needed and are posted on this website and at City Hall 72 hours prior to the meeting date and time.
* Sign up through our [Notify Me](http://www.taylortx.gov/list.aspx "Notify Me registration page")service to automatically receive agendas at the time they are posted or visit our [Meetings](https://www.taylortx.gov/642/Council-Meetings?amp;ART=3123&ADMIN=1 "About Council Meetings") page for more information.
* Citizens who wish to address the City Council may do so by filling out a [Citizens Communication](https://na4.documents.adobe.com/public/esignWidget?wid=CBFCIBAA3AAABLblqZhCMuItxmAon97AZey4BJ9vwovlhYLDRDPCjHuhyKDdyeCNfjPJkToaGny7sWeneFoo*) form 15 minutes in advance of the meeting at City Council Chambers.

Vision
------

Taylor is a vibrant, diverse, friendly, growing community that has retained our historic character and small-town feel. We are financially stable and are known for our ...

* Exceptional mobility/connectivity
* Diversity of housing and businesses
* Beautiful parks
* Engage citizens
* Facilities and programs for people in every stage of life

The City Council vision statement is part of the 2020 adopted Strategic Plan to guide City Staff in developing programs and strategies for the good of the community. [To view the Strategic Plan, click here.](http://www.taylortx.gov/253/Strategic-Plan) 

**For requests for media interviews**, please contact the City of Taylor Communications Department at 512-352-5448 or email:  communications@taylortx.gov
